alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 7:56PM MDT until June 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Cache La Poudre River near Greeley affecting Weld County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cache La Poudre River near Greeley. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Sections of the Poudre River Trail begin to overtop from Windsor to Greeley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.4 feet Friday evening. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
